conclusion: Inside the box there are four fixed, slanted baffles: black, purple, yellow, and cyan.
The black baffle sits highest and slopes downwards toward the left side of the box.
The purple baffle is a little lower and slopes downwards toward the right.
A yellow baffle low on the left and a cyan baffle low on the right complete the course.
The three inlets A, B, C are arranged left-to-right along the top.
At the bottom are three separate catch-pockets D (left), E (centre), F (right).
Stream A (left-hand inlet) lands on the upper black baffle.

premise: Stream A lands on the upper black baffle.
conclusion: Stream A is carried down-and-left, clears the yellow baffle, and drops straight into the left-hand pocket D.
Stream B (middle inlet) just misses the black baffle and hits the upper end of the purple baffle.

premise: Stream B hits the upper end of the purple baffle.
conclusion: Stream B is pushed down-and-right, then the cyan baffle guides it farther right so it falls into the right-hand pocket F.
Stream C (right-hand inlet) falls near the right wall and catches the lower end of the purple baffle.

premise: Stream C catches the lower end of the purple baffle.
conclusion: Stream C is sent down-and-left, passes the yellow baffle, and drops into the centre pocket E.

premise: Stream A ends in container D; stream B ends in container F; stream C ends in container E.
conclusion: Final prediction: A → D, B → F, C → E.
